file_content.text: Keeping my head bowed, lord. Enjoy exploring the city. Lord Baras will meet you in his chambers.
You're the one, yes. Not like the scabs that exited the shuttle with you. You radiate power, lord. I bow before you.
I serve Lord Baras. He sent me to meet his new apprentice. And I made sure I was here on time, I certainly did. Yes indeed.
So, I'm met. Now what?
What of it?
Baras should have met me himself.
Sending you is an insult.
Oh, uh, it is not my place to question the master.
I hope you don't expect a reward.
I'm not giving you anything.
Serving and being allowed to live is reward enough.
I'm just a slave who owes his every breath to the tolerance of Lord Baras. He said to introduce you to Dromund Kaas, and I take that seriously.
Get on with it. I don't have all day.
Then do your duty.
Right away. You don't have to tell me twice.
You have a strong survival instinct.
That's the key to long life.
Thank you, kind lord. I am seldom referred to as strong.
Your breathing is now dependent on my tolerance as well.
Take me seriously or else.
Yes, my lord. I exist by your good grace.
Lord Baras ordered me to encourage you to explore Kaas City before reporting to him. Imperials maintain the order, but they won't bother you.
The Citadel is the Empire's military center. Lord Baras's office is there, where all the top Sith reside. No doubt you may have a chamber there someday.
Your mouth moves, but I gain nothing from it.
Do you have a point?
Apologies, my lord. Truly.
Thanks for the encouragement.
Nice of you to say.
Being so lowly gives me the proper perspective to notice your greatness.
Don't brownnose me, maggot.
I don't like a kiss-up.
Just stating the obvious, lord. I meant no disrespect--the exact opposite, in fact.
When you're ready, Lord Baras will meet you in his personal chambers. You, uh, you will tell Lord Baras I was good, yes? That I served well?
You did exactly what you were told.
You were acceptable.
He knows a lie when he hears one.
No.
A lie? But I--I thought I performed the task with complete commitment. Is that not so, lord?
Must I repeat myself?
Did I stutter?
No, no, lord, I understand you plainly.
Forget it, you did fine.
You're right.
You have my thanks, gentle juggernaut.
I bow my head until you depart.
You dare question me?
Die, worm! [Attack]
Just get out of my sight.
Go away.
Have I done something to offend? How may I make amends, lord?
Don't make me repeat myself.
I said leave.
I see I've overstayed my welcome. I hope to be of service again. Goodbye.
You're fine, just go about your business.
No need, friend.
Thank you, lord. I'll get out of your hair.
Wow, what a weasel. Dromund Kaas needs some pest control.
You'd be their first target.
Now that you're here.
Yeah yeah, very funny.
I hope others in Baras's operation have a little backbone.
You said it.
Somehow, I doubt you're the only one.
Wow. You showed remarkable restraint with him.
Don't think it'll apply to you.
Won't last.
No, of course not. Why would I ever expect that.
And exactly why would that be hard to believe?
Don't act surprised.
Uh, no reason. Forget I said anything.
Your very existence offends me.
You can die. [Attack]
What did I do? No!
Wow. Didn't take you long to start the Dromund Kaas death toll.
We're moving on. Keep up.
Let's go.
Do you want to be the next addition?
It's about to double.
Uh, I think I'll pass.
It was a long shuttle ride.
I was bored.
You were going through withdrawal, I get it.
